thread.title: REVEALED: Secret last episode of Only Fools And Horses
thread.title_full: REVEALED: Secret last episode of Only Fools And Horses

title: REVEALED: Secret last episode of Only Fools And Horses
text:
NC REVEALED: Secret plans for a final episode of Only Fools And Horses 
Writer John Sullivan was aiming to do a farewell show about a hilarious reunion for Del Boy’s 65th birthday. 
But he died in 2011 before getting the chance to complete it. 
John Challis, who played Boycie in the hit sitcom, revealed Sullivan wanted Del Boy (David Jason) and Rodney (Nicholas Lyndhurst) back in Nelson Mandela House for one last hurrah. 
REX WRITER: John Sullivan was aiming to do a farewell show “Just before John died he was actually getting together a special for us” John Challis 
The veteran actor revealed the plot would have seen all the old regulars like Trigger, Denzil and Marlene return to Peckham. 
The one-off special would have brought the comedy to a triumphant end and given closure to all the characters. 
But sadly the script was never completed. 
NC SHOW: John Challis played Boycie in the hit sitcom 
“Just before John died he was actually getting together a special for us,” 74-year-old Challis said. 
“It was going to be Del Boy’s 65th birthday – for which everyone would meet at The Nag’s Head – and retirement. 
“Everyone was going to be part of that.” 
NC ACTOR: David Jason played Del Boy 'This Morning' blunders Tuesday, 7th February 2017 When live TV goes horribly wrong: Take a look at Holly and Phil's best This Morning blunders. 1 / 23 
It would have aired as part of the show’s 30th anniversary celebrations. 
But the episode will be lost forever as Sullivan became too ill and passed away aged 64 from viral pneumonia in 2011. 
The Boycie actor added: “Unfortunately John got ill and never recovered, so it never happened.” Related articles
